official-title.#text:
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to provide for equal treatment of individuals in
			 same-sex marriages, and for other purposes.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Social Security and Medicare Parity Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Social Security and Medicare Parity Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Determination of valid marriage under the Social Security Act

quote.#text:
and such applicant were married (or, if such insured individual and such applicant were not married
			 in any State but were validly married in another jurisdiction, the courts
			 of any State)

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 216(h)(1)(A)(i) of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to all final determinations of family status made
			 after June 26, 2013.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 216(k) of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Alternative method of meeting nine-month requirement for widows, stepchildren, or widowers in
			 certain cases

quote.#text:
in Case of Accidental Death or in Case of Serviceman Dying in Line of Duty, or in Case of
			 Remarriage to the Same Individual

in
in

in the case of a widow or widower of such individual whose marriage to such individual would not

became the wife or husband of such individual (or was deemed to be the wife or husband of such

if such widow or widower is domiciled in any other State—
before March 26, 2014; or

if applicable, during the 9-month period beginning with the 1st date on which such State recognized
			 same-sex marriages, civil unions, or registered domestic partnerships; and

provides a sworn affidavit that the widow or widower was married to, or in a domestic partnership
			 with, such individual throughout the 9-month period ending on the date of
			 the individual’s death; or
the stepchild of such individual—

became the stepchild of such individual as a result of a parent of the stepchild becoming the wife
			 or husband of such individual (or being deemed to be the wife or husband
			 of such individual under

if such parent is domiciled in a State that recognized same-sex marriages, civil unions, or

if such parent is domiciled in any other State—
before March 26, 2014; or

if applicable, during the 9-month period beginning with the 1st date on which such State recognized
			 same-sex marriages, civil unions, or registered domestic partnerships; and

that the spouse of an individual shall

			 or husband’s insurance benefits is filed in order to qualify as such
			 individual's wife or husband, and the requirement in

that the stepchild of an individual shall have been such
			 stepchild for not less than 1 year immediately preceding the day on which
			 application for child's insurance benefits is filed in order to qualify as
			 such individual's child, shall be deemed to be satisfied, where such
			 application is filed within the applicable 1-year period, if—

text.#text: The requirement in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 216(b)(2) of the Social Security Act

header.#text:
Alternative method of meeting 1-year requirement for wives, stepchildren, or husbands in certain
			 cases

text.#text:
in the case of a wife or husband of such individual whose marriage to such individual would not
			 have been treated as a marriage for purposes of Federal law prior to June
			 26, 2013, such wife or husband—

became the wife or husband of such individual (or was deemed to be the wife or husband of such
			 individual under
if such wife or husband is domiciled in any other State—
before June 26, 2014; or

if applicable, during the 1-year period beginning with the 1st date on which such State recognized
			 same-sex marriages, civil unions, or registered domestic partnerships; and

provides a sworn affidavit that the wife or husband was married to, or in a domestic partnership
			 with, such individual throughout the 1-year period ending on the date of
			 the application for wife’s or husband’s insurance benefits; or
the stepchild of such individual—

became the stepchild of such individual as a result of a parent of the stepchild becoming the wife
			 or husband of such individual (or being deemed to be the wife or husband
			 of such individual under

if such parent is domiciled in a State that recognized same-sex marriages, civil unions, or
			 registered domestic partnerships as of June 26, 2013, before June 26,
			 2014; and
if such parent is domiciled in any other State—
before June 26, 2014; or

if applicable, during the 1-year period beginning with the 1st date on which such State recognized
			 same-sex marriages, civil unions, or registered domestic partnerships; and

provides a sworn affidavit that such parent was married to, or in a domestic partnership with, such
			 individual throughout the 1-year period ending on the date of the
			 application for child's insurance benefits.

header.#text: Notification of changes in law; outreach campaign

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall conduct a comprehensive
			 and effective 3-year outreach campaign to encourage individuals newly
			 eligible for benefits under

as a
			 result of changes in law relating to same-sex marriage and occurring on or
			 after June 26, 2013, including this Act and the amendments made thereby,
			 to apply for such benefits. Such outreach campaign shall include direct
			 notification regarding such changes in law to current beneficiaries and to
			 individuals approaching retirement.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title II of the Social Security Act

text.#text:
As soon as practicable after the date of the enactment of this Act but not later than December 31,
			 2014, the

			 Representatives
